actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil Service and General Services.
Subcommittee on Civil Service and General Services. Hearings held. Hearings printed:  S.Hrg. 98-552.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Approved for reporting without amendment favorably.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil Service, Post Office, and General Services

official_title: A bill to amend chapter 71 of title 5, United States Code, to provide for the operational continuity of the Office of the General Counsel of the Federal Labor Relations Authority during a vacancy in the position of the General Counsel.

summary.text: Authorizes the President to designate an officer or employee of the Federal Labor Relations Authority to act as General Counsel during any vacancy in such office. Prohibits such individual from acting as General Counsel for longer than the first 40-day period of continuous session of Congress beginning after his or her designation, unless a nomination to fill such vacancy has been submitted in the Senate before the end of such period.

titles.title: A bill to amend chapter 71 of title 5, United States Code, to provide for the operational continuity of the Office of the General Counsel of the Federal Labor Relations Authority during a vacancy in the position of the General Counsel.
